meanings.definition: To check again for accuracy or correctness.
meanings.sent1: I need to recheck my math homework to make sure I didn't make any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: After finishing the puzzle, she decided to recheck her work to ensure everything was in its right place.
meanings.sent3: He had to recheck the recipe multiple times to avoid turning his cookies into rocks.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to recheck the evidence to uncover the hidden truth.
meanings.sent5: Before submitting the report, it's crucial to recheck all the facts and figures for accuracy.

meanings.definition: A second or subsequent check for accuracy or correctness.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's recheck of the test revealed a few errors that needed correction.
meanings.sent2: As a final step, the system performs a recheck to ensure all data is accurate.
meanings.sent3: The recheck of the inventory confirmed that all items were accounted for.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic's recheck of the car's engine revealed the source of the problem.
meanings.sent5: The recheck of the document highlighted some discrepancies that needed further investigation.
